Title:
Biosynthesis of extracellular melanin pigment by Amorphotheca
resinae KUC3009
Keywords:
Keywords: Amorphotheca resinae; melanin pigments;
extracellular melanin; fungal melanin.
Abstract:
Melanins have emerged as functional pigments with diverse
industrial applications. However, the extraction and purification of
melanins from natural sources is inefficient and not adequate for large
scale production. Alternatively, fermentative approaches based on
filamentous fungi cultivation can be a feasible solution. In this study,
102 isolates of filamentous fungi were evaluated for their ability to
produce extracellular melanin, and a single isolate was selected. The
promising isolate was identified as Amorphotheca resinae by
chemotaxonomic and morphological characterization, and the melanin was
produced rapidly during the autolysis phase of cell growth, reaching up
4.5 g/L. Furthermore, elemental analysis, EPR, 13C solid-state NMR, and
pyrolysis-GC-MS were carried out for structural characterization of the
melanin from A. resinae and comparison with standard melanins. The
results indicated that the structure of extracellular melanin was
similar to Sepia eumelanin. Consequently, the A. resinae identified is a
good candidate for commercial eumelanin production.
